title: Donald Trump's phone call to Matt Gaetz: 'You don't have the votes'
content: The real reason why Matt Gaetz withdrew his nomination for attorney general was a call from Donald Trump hours before Gaetz announced his decision. Despite lobbying efforts by Gaetz, Trump, and JD Vance, Gaetz lacked the necessary votes for confirmation. Gaetz stated his decision aimed to avoid distractions and ensure a swift transition for the Trump administration. Pam Bondi was nominated as his replacement.
summary: The real reason why Matt Gaetz withdrew his nomination for attorney general was a call from Donald Trump hours before Gaetz announced his decision. Despite lobbying efforts by Gaetz, Trump, and JD Vance, Gaetz lacked the necessary votes for confirmation. Gaetz stated his decision aimed to avoid distractions and ensure a swift transition for the Trump administration. Pam Bondi was nominated as his replacement.

title: How Elon Musk added 70 billion dollars to his wealth since Trump won
content: He might as well have been speaking about his new BFF and the nation’s first buddy Elon Musk who just can’t stop winning since Donald Trump came back to power. Elon Musk, already a dominant force in the business world, has now cemented his place in history as the wealthiest person ever. Thanks to a $70 billion surge in his net worth following Donald Trump's election victory, Musk’s fortune has soared to unparalleled levels, making him not only the richest individual alive but also the wealthiest ever tracked by Forbes.

title: Elon Musk reveals what he thinks about Epstein and Diddy files
content: Despite Donald Trump's alleged link to sex offender Epstein which the President-elect brushed aside, Donald Trump said he would be inclined to release all Epstein documents. Now the Republicans are pitching for the release of Diddy files. Elon Musk revealed his opinion on the release of both Epstein and Diddy files.

title: Putin: Russia may use new missile again after attack on Ukraine
content: Following Ukraine's use of US and UK-supplied missiles on Russian territory, Putin announced the successful test of a new missile, the Oreshnik, which was used to strike Dnipro. Putin emphasized that Russia possesses a stockpile of these missiles and has initiated mass production, indicating their potential use in future combat scenarios depending on perceived security threats to Russia.
summary: Following Ukraine's use of US and UK-supplied missiles on Russian territory, Putin announced the successful test of a new missile, the Oreshnik, which was used to strike Dnipro.  Putin emphasized that Russia possesses a stockpile of these missiles and has initiated mass production, indicating their potential use in future combat scenarios depending on perceived security threats to Russia.

title: Trump nominates hedge fund chief Scott Bessent to lead US treasury
content: Donald Trump has chosen Scott Bessent, a seasoned hedge fund manager, to lead the US Treasury in his second term. Bessent, known for his advocacy of Trump's economic policies, will be tasked with implementing a bold agenda that includes tax cuts, potential currency policy shifts, and navigating complex international economic diplomacy.

Bessent, known for his advocacy of Trump's economic policies, will be tasked with implementing a bold agenda that includes tax cuts, potential currency policy shifts, and navigating complex international economic diplomacy.

title: Daniel Penny opts not to testify as his defense rests in manslaughter trial: 'How much jury...'
content: Daniel Penny's defense team rested their case without the Marine veteran taking the stand in his manslaughter trial for the death of Jordan Neely. The defense highlighted Neely's outstanding arrest warrant and presented witnesses who described Neely's behavior on the subway as erratic and threatening.
summary: Daniel Penny's defense team rested their case without the Marine veteran taking the stand in his manslaughter trial for the death of Jordan Neely. The defense highlighted Neely's outstanding arrest warrant and presented witnesses who described Neely's behavior on the subway as erratic and threatening.

title: Texas education board approves Bible-based curriculum for elementary schools
content: In a controversial move, the Texas State Board of Education approved new elective curriculum allowing Bible lessons in elementary schools. Supporters believe the Bible is crucial to American history, while critics argue it blurs the lines between religion and public education. This decision could potentially impact over 5 million students and set a precedent for other states.
summary: In a controversial move, the Texas State Board of Education approved new elective curriculum allowing Bible lessons in elementary schools. Supporters believe the Bible is crucial to American history, while critics argue it blurs the lines between religion and public education. This decision could potentially impact over 5 million students and set a precedent for other states.

title: US man receives 'life-changing' face transplant 10 years after suicide attempt: 'It was truly a miracle'
content: After surviving a suicide attempt a decade ago that left his face severely disfigured, a Michigan man has received a life-altering face transplant. title: Diddy smiles, blows kiss to family in court, makes 3rd bail attempt
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs appeared in a Manhattan court for a third bail hearing, seeking release on a $50 million bond while awaiting trial on racketeering and sex-trafficking charges. Combs, who denies the allegations, has been jailed since September. Prosecutors allege witness tampering, while the defense decries the claims and challenges the seizure of Combs's handwritten notes from his jail cell.
summary: Sean "Diddy" Combs appeared in a Manhattan court for a third bail hearing, seeking release on a $50 million bond while awaiting trial on racketeering and sex-trafficking charges. Combs, who denies the allegations, has been jailed since September. Prosecutors allege witness tampering, while the defense decries the claims and challenges the seizure of Combs's handwritten notes from his jail cell.

title: Florida woman arrested for drowning and killing 14-year-old daughter in bathtub
content: A Florida woman, Kelsey Glover, is facing charges after allegedly drowning her 14-year-old daughter, Giselle, in a bathtub. Witnesses, including another child, reported seeing Glover holding Giselle underwater. Glover then allegedly attacked witnesses with a hammer. While currently charged with assault and battery, authorities are awaiting the medical examiner's report to potentially upgrade charges.
summary: A Florida woman, Kelsey Glover, is facing charges after allegedly drowning her 14-year-old daughter, Giselle, in a bathtub. Witnesses, including another child, reported seeing Glover holding Giselle underwater.  Glover then allegedly attacked witnesses with a hammer. While currently charged with assault and battery, authorities are awaiting the medical examiner's report to potentially upgrade charges.

title: Elon Musk asks Donald Trump Jr how much MSNBC costs. X users say, 'We've been here before'
content: ​"How much it cost," Elon Musk replied and X users could not keep their calm. The screenshot of Elon Musk asking about the cost of then-Twitter in 2017 went viral. Meanwhile, Donald Trump Jr replied: "I mean it can't be much. Look at the ratings". ​Comcast recently announced plans to pin off cable networks including MSNBC and E! as their ratings dip. MSNBC, E!, CNBC, USA, Oxygen, SYFY and the Golf Channel will form part of a new, publicly traded company, while Comcast focuses on brands including NBC and Bravo, it announced.
summary: ​"How much it cost," Elon Musk replied and X users could not keep their calm. The screenshot of Elon Musk asking about the cost of then-Twitter in 2017 went viral. title: Watch: Passengers duct-tape man who demanded to exit American Airlines flight midair
content: An American Airlines flight from Milwaukee to Dallas-Fort Worth turned chaotic when a Canadian passenger attempted to open a cabin door mid-flight, claiming he needed to exit. The situation escalated quickly as the agitated passenger injured a flight attendant while trying to reach the door.
summary: An American Airlines flight from Milwaukee to Dallas-Fort Worth turned chaotic when a Canadian passenger attempted to open a cabin door mid-flight, claiming he needed to exit. The situation escalated quickly as the agitated passenger injured a flight attendant while trying to reach the door.

title: When Ellen DeGeneres 'offered' Donald Trump her mom to date. Old video goes viral
content: British broadcaster Piers Morgan mockingly reacted to the news of Ellen leaving the US to settle in England writing: "OMG...no!". Ellen was forced to end her Ellen Degeneres Show after a report accused her of fostering a toxic workplace environment. ​After Ellen's news, an old clip of Ellen with Donald Trump went viral in which Ellen offered her mother to Trump for dating - as part of the joke they were playing. "Yeah, look at her. And she is available if you are interested. I'd like to offer her..." Ellen told Trump.

title: What immigration policies are expected in Trump's second administration?
content: Donald Trump, in his bid for re-election, has vowed to implement stringent immigration measures if he returns to the White House. His plans include large-scale deportations, bolstering border security, and overturning existing policies like DACA. Trump's proposals have sparked controversy and legal challenges, setting the stage for a contentious debate on immigration.
summary: Donald Trump, in his bid for re-election, has vowed to implement stringent immigration measures if he returns to the White House. His plans include large-scale deportations, bolstering border security, and overturning existing policies like DACA. Trump's proposals have sparked controversy and legal challenges, setting the stage for a contentious debate on immigration.

title: Matt Gaetz reveals his future plan: 'Won't return to Congress, will fight for...'
content: In an interview with Charlie Kirk, Matt Gaetz revealed that he will not be returning to Congress now that he is not a nomination for the attorney general post. Gaetz stated that he would continue to support former President Donald Trump and would be "a big voice" outside of elected office.
summary: In an interview with Charlie Kirk, Matt Gaetz revealed that he will not be returning to Congress now that he is not a nomination for the attorney general post. Gaetz stated that he would continue to support former President Donald Trump and would be "a big voice" outside of elected office.

title: Fact check: Did Elon Musk accuse Jeff Bezos' ex-wife, MacKenzie Scott, of 'destroying Western civilization'?
content: Elon Musk sparked controversy with a now-deleted tweet, suggesting that wealthy ex-wives like MacKenzie Scott, who criticize their former husbands, are a contributing factor to the downfall of Western civilization. Musk's comment was in response to a post highlighting Scott's philanthropic efforts, which largely focus on racial and gender equality.

title: Melania cooks for Trump, Barron as RFK Jr wants to change President-elect's diet
content: Melania Trump has been preparing family dinners at Trump Tower and encouraging healthier eating habits for her husband, President-elect Donald Trump, Page Six reported adding that Melania and Kennedy Jr have ganged up on Trump to make him eat healthy. The report comes as Kennedy himself was seen posing with McDonald's food. But insiders said it was just for fun and Kennedy probably didn't eat those.

title: Trump’s hush money case sentencing postponed indefinitely, granted permission to seek dismissal
content: A judge has indefinitely delayed the sentencing of former President Donald Trump in his criminal hush money case. Trump's legal team successfully argued for a postponement, citing potential disruptions to his presidential duties. The judge also granted Trump permission to file for dismissal of the case, setting deadlines for December.
summary: A judge has indefinitely delayed the sentencing of former President Donald Trump in his criminal hush money case. Trump's legal team successfully argued for a postponement, citing potential disruptions to his presidential duties. The judge also granted Trump permission to file for dismissal of the case, setting deadlines for December.

title: Did Trump leave Mar-a-Lago in ambulance? Here is the truth
content: Speculation arose on social media about Donald Trump's health after reports of ambulances leaving Mar-a-Lago. However, the Secret Service clarified that the ambulances were part of Vice President-elect JD Vance's motorcade and not related to any emergency involving Trump. Trump's communications director criticized reporters for spreading unfounded rumors, highlighting the intense scrutiny surrounding the former president's health.
summary: Speculation arose on social media about Donald Trump's health after reports of ambulances leaving Mar-a-Lago. However, the Secret Service clarified that the ambulances were part of Vice President-elect JD Vance's motorcade and not related to any emergency involving Trump. Trump's communications director criticized reporters for spreading unfounded rumors, highlighting the intense scrutiny surrounding the former president's health.

title: Mike Rogers won't get FBI, claims Trump team member. It's only Kash Patel then?
content: Former President Donald Trump is not considering Mike Rogers, a former FBI special agent and congressman, for a leadership role at the FBI, according to Trump's deputy chief of staff. While Trump is seeking a MAGA loyalist to potentially replace FBI Director Christopher Wray, experts have expressed concerns over another candidate, Kash Patel, due to his controversial past.
summary: Former President Donald Trump is not considering Mike Rogers, a former FBI special agent and congressman, for a leadership role at the FBI, according to Trump's deputy chief of staff. While Trump is seeking a MAGA loyalist to potentially replace FBI Director Christopher Wray, experts have expressed concerns over another candidate, Kash Patel, due to his controversial past.
